channel.title: sdwdate on old version workstation
channel.description:
hi, at first sorry for my english and propaply stupid question. I'm using old version workstation - 4.19.0.9, and from today (it worked yerstaday) it can't make sdwdate succes. Initial time fetching in progress all time. I suspect that it's because sdwdate is trying request urls from old onion sites (with short adress), for example (I deleted urls because this site tell me that I can't post urls):
2022-05-22 10:16:46 - sdwdate - INFO - Running sdwdate fetch loop. iteration: 3 2022-05-22 10:16:46 - sdwdate - INFO - Requested urls ['gmg7jl25ony5g7ws', 'bvhfrslkkdbncdhv'] 2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - Returned urls "['gmg7jl25ony5g7ws', 'bvhfrslkkdbncdhv']" 2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - remote 0: gmg7jl25ony5g7ws 2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - * comment: Gizmodo Media Group specialprojects 2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - * status: False 2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - * value: Timeout 2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - remote 1: bvhfrslkkdbncdhv 2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - * comment: Canal Etico denuncias.bufetecarrasco 2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - * status: False 2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - * value: Timeout
and so on many many times. By the way, internet works ok without sdwdate succes.
My new workstation request this urls from new onion sites(with long adress) and everything ok. I don't sure that problem is what I just said, but anyway I want to make sdwdate succes on my old workstation, is it possible? Or now I can only use new version? Propably I can somehow upgrade that onion site's list, or something like this. I tried to google it and read curl manual (if I comprehend right sdwdate uses curl), but it's all too hard for me.

item.title: sdwdate on old version workstation
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Unsupported.

Whonix 15 End of Security Support and Deprecation Notice - All users should move to Whonix 16! News
As per Whonix Support Schedule, this post serves as Whonix version 15 deprecation notice. Whonix 16 stable has been released for all platforms. Qubes-Whonix 16 has been Released! (Debian 11 bullseye based) - Major Release Whonix 16 has been Released! (Debian 11 bullseye based) - for VirtualBox - Major Release / Whonix 16.0.3.1 - for VirtualBox - Point Release! Whonix 16.0.2.7 KVM (Debian 11 bullseye based) - Major Stable Release Whonix 15 will be deprecated on 14 November 2021. All users …

Old versions support is unsupported / declined.

Kicksecure – 15 Apr 22

Declined Feature Requests

Declined feature requests. Out-of-scope feature suggestions that are not on the Kicksecure ™ development roadmap.

Read full topic

item.title: sdwdate on old version workstation
item.dc:creator: lattt
item.description:
hi, at first sorry for my english and propaply stupid question. I’m using old version workstation - 4.19.0.9, and from today (it worked yerstaday) it can’t make sdwdate succes. Initial time fetching in progress all time. I suspect that it’s because sdwdate is trying request urls from old onion sites (with short adress), for example (I deleted urls because this site tell me that I can’t post urls):

2022-05-22 10:16:46 - sdwdate - INFO - Running sdwdate fetch loop. iteration: 3
2022-05-22 10:16:46 - sdwdate - INFO - Requested urls [‘gmg7jl25ony5g7ws’, ‘bvhfrslkkdbncdhv’]
2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - Returned urls “[‘gmg7jl25ony5g7ws’, ‘bvhfrslkkdbncdhv’]”
2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - remote 0: gmg7jl25ony5g7ws
2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - * comment: Gizmodo Media Group specialprojects
2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - * status: False
2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - * value: Timeout
2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - remote 1: bvhfrslkkdbncdhv
2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - * comment: Canal Etico denuncias.bufetecarrasco
2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - * status: False
2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - * value: Timeout

and so on many many times. By the way, internet works ok without sdwdate succes.

My new workstation request this urls from new onion sites(with long adress) and everything ok. I don’t sure that problem is what I just said, but anyway I want to make sdwdate succes on my old workstation, is it possible? Or now I can only use new version? Propably I can somehow upgrade that onion site’s list, or something like this. I tried to google it and read curl manual (if I comprehend right sdwdate uses curl), but it’s all too hard for me.

Read full topic
